name: React
description: currently the most popular front-end JavaScript framework along with Vue and Angular

resources.name: Examples of consuming APIs with fetch and axios
resources.description: This code shows how to load data from APIs using both the standard fetch() as well as the library axios().

resources.name: Create a reusable todolist component in React that uses localStorage
resources.description: This sample app shows a number of concepts: (1) how to create components that are 100% separate from each other, you can create as many todolist components as you want, (2) how to use useRef to programmatically set focus in a field, (3) how to use localStorage to save todo-list data in the user's browser, and (4) how to use radio buttons in React.

name: GraphQL
description: a newer and more robust alternative to REST

resources.name: How to set up a GraphQL backend with MongoDB and Express
resources.description: The project shows you how to setup a GraphQL server locally with Apollo and Express which serves data from a MongoDB database.

resources.name: Build a two-page website with Gatsby and host at Netlify
resources.description: These instructions will show you how to get a Gatsby website up and running witih GraphQL.
